By standardizing training, we can equip medical professionals across our health care system to prevent, identify, treat, and manage patients with opioid and other substance use disorders.
This starts with addressing stigma and lack of understanding on addiction which persist even within the medical community.

This legislation is an effective way forward in ensuring that Americans access evidence-based care for this chronic, treatable disease. We must take a comprehensive, multi-pronged approach that strengthens the infrastructure around prevention and treatment.

There is not a community in Massachusetts or the US that is immune from substance use disorder - especially when it comes to the opioid crisis. Today I was proud to lead the bipartisan introduction of the #MATEAct. https://trahan.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=1293¬†‚Ä¶
